Description: Bronze strainer in form of a dish with perforations.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Egypt, Abydos, tomb of Idy
Curator's comments: Bibliography: J. G. Wilkinson, The Egyptians in the time of the pharaohs. Being a companion to the Crystal Palace Egyptian collections (London 1857), 59. John F. Nunn, Ancient Egyptian Medicine, London 1996, p. 139 (incorrectly dated to the Ptolemaic period). J.H. Taylor & D. Antoine, Ancient lives, new discoveries, London 2014, p. 55. J. H. Taylor in I. Regulski (ed.), Abydos. The Sacred land at the Western Horizon (Leuven, Paris, Bristol 2019), 282-3, figs 8-9. The object formed part of the ritual equipment associated with the offering table and utensils of Idy (EA 5315) and was originally displayed as part of that group, but was subsequently numbered separately as EA 38230.
Exhibition history: 2014-15 22 May to 19 April, London, British Museum, 'Ancient Lives, New Discoveries'
